Alice.Action: Wakes up disoriented, unsure of her surroundings and own body, showing confusion and lack of awareness.
Moves cautiously around the mansion, investigating her environment despite memory gaps.
Notices details like bruises and scars on her body, indicating some level of self-awareness and attentiveness.
Looks at a photograph of herself and a man with a wedding ring, tries to remember their relationship.
Hangs in a vent to avoid deadly lasers, showing quick thinking and self-preservation.
Cautiously pushes open the access hatch and moves carefully through dangerous, unfamiliar ground, demonstrating perseverance.
Triggers traps accidentally but takes care in movement, suggesting prudence rather than care for others specifically.
Swings into the air duct at the last moment to escape the deadly laser grid, narrowly avoiding being burnt.
Crawls cautiously through the tight, dark air duct showing persistence and spatial awareness.
Pushes open the access hatch cautiously, indicating careful exploration.
Uses a gurney to probe the corridor ahead for traps, indicating tactical thinking and cautiousness.
Triggers a concealed wire trap that slices the gurney, but successfully avoids injury.
Accidentally triggers a second trap (a jumping jack mine) which explodes and fatally wounds her.
Stops to listen to a desperate SOS radio transmission and investigates the location despite danger.
Shows no emotion upon hearing a threatening growling sound behind her, remaining calm and focused.
Includes and accepts Paco, a fierce and loyal stray dog, showing tolerance and companionship.
Uses a radio receiver strapped to her bike to pick up a distress signal and listens carefully.
Fills the bike’s empty gas tank using a funnel and gasoline from a can marked with the Umbrella logo, showing resourcefulness.
Approaches a dangerous, bullet-riddled, boarded-up TV station instead of ignoring the distress call, demonstrating courage and willingness to investigate.
Remains calm and shows no emotion despite hearing threatening growling sounds behind her.
Inspects the saddlebag after hearing growling and calmly handles the situation when a dog named Paco jumps out.
Nods to Paco reassuringly before descending into dangerous, dark basement; leads the dog into unknown risks.
Approaches a potentially hostile figure cautiously, gun ready but shows no aggression unnecessarily.
Stares emotionless at the dead body of Bob Smythee, showing no visible grief or empathy.
Pockets spare shotgun cartridges from the dead man's body without hesitation or apparent remorse.
Approaches the figure cautiously with her gun ready, inspects the control booth carefully, takes ammunition from the dead man.
Stares emotionlessly at the dead man but quickly picks up useful materials (notebook, shotgun cartridges).
Shelters and saves Paco by shooting undead pursuers, protects her dog fiercely.
Ensures Paco is safe by calling him to hide before the timer goes off.
Rescues Paco from pursuers, quickly draws shotgun, and effectively kills multiple undead attackers with precise shooting.
Notices a countdown timer on her watch and immediately takes methodical measures to cover her tracks, protect her vehicle, and hide effectively before the timer runs out.
Successfully calls Paco to join her just before potential detection, showing situational awareness and control of the environment.
Steps out into the open after the 'all clear' signal without checking the sky again.
Successfully camouflages motorbike and escapes with Paco, showing planning and caution.
Provides a clear, informed narration on the spread of the virus, demonstrating knowledge and insight.
Analyzes and explains the collapse of society and failed containment efforts with calm clarity.
Leads or chooses to stay on the move, avoiding major population centers to stay alive.
Acts as a narrator relaying factual information and strategic decisions without apparent hesitation or confusion.
Shows hesitation and says 'Sorry about this Stevie...' before taking aim at an Undead, indicating regret and a measure of empathy even towards a former human now turned foe.
Remains focused and efficient in assembling and loading a deadly crossbow to confront the threat, demonstrating pragmatism but limited outward friendliness in the moment.
Hides herself and her vehicle perfectly under camouflage netting, remaining invisible to satellite scans.
Uses binoculars to carefully scout and assess the situation at the Arco gas station before engaging.
Assembles and loads a deadly crossbow with precision and calmness, preparing to take a carefully aimed shot.
Says 'Sorry about this Stevie' before killing him with a crossbow bolt to the head.
Kills Stevie, who is likely a former companion or human, without hesitation.
Turns off the radio broadcasting survivor messages, isolating herself and Paco.
Shares a quiet, familiar moment with Paco, the little dog, acknowledging its presence.
Reads a journal with careful attention, showing interest in the hope of a safe haven (Arcadia), indicating openness to others' experiences.
Turns off the radio after hearing the hopeless broadcast, showing selective attention and emotional control in a bleak situation.
Makes camp alone with Paco, demonstrating self-sufficiency and survival skills.
Reads the red journal carefully to gather intelligence about a safe location, indicating resourcefulness and strategic thinking.
Idly leafs through the journal without showing immediate urgency or planning following the grim information, suggesting possible passivity.
Unwittingly transmits resistance information to Umbrella due to subconscious control, indicating vulnerability and lack of trustworthiness in this moment.
Unwittingly transmits sensitive resistance information to Umbrella due to ALICE VISION spy system.
Is seen as a hero of the resistance and is being shown around their hub, indicating established respect and skill.
Cradles the dead body of Angie, showing deep grief and tears.
Wipes her tears but remains emotionally affected by others' suffering.
Remains unmoving and silent in the face of chaos and violence.
Unmoved and tearful, cradles dead Angie and screams silently during chaos.
Wakes instantly, gun in hand, ready for trouble as fires and floating rocks appear and stop abruptly.
After the event, reacts emotionally, wiping tears and assessing the damaged bike.
Encourages Paco the dog playfully by saying 'Go get him tiger'
Carries all her gear and carefully fuels the abandoned vehicle to continue their journey
Watches calmly as Paco chases the rabbit, showing situational awareness and composure.
Carries essential supplies (saddlebags, radio, gasoline) indicating preparedness and resourcefulness.
Successfully starts an abandoned pickup truck after a few attempts, demonstrating practical mechanical skill under pressure.
Arrives calmly and confidently at the dangerous scene, showing control and authority by declaring 'I'm not your problem.'
Commands Mikey to 'sever the spinal column' to kill Undead motor functions, then charges into battle alone to protect the camp.
Stands confidently in the midst of the Undead, maintaining a protective circle of blades around her.
Stands confidently surrounded by undead, defending herself skillfully with blades.
Shows relief upon hearing Carlos is alive, indicating awareness of allies but also momentary emotional distraction.
Glances at the fire truck and mounted flamethrowers but recognizes it is inaccessible, showing situational awareness.
Begins to concentrate inwardly, accessing a subconscious power to manipulate fire in the battlefield.
Uses a superhuman effort to unleash a firestorm that incinerates multiple Undead rapidly and effectively.
Collapses immediately after using her power, showing physical and mental exhaustion.
Forces herself to her feet despite weakness and races to save the group by moving the Tanker away from imminent danger.
Pushes Sven (Undead) away to protect others despite her weakened state.
Forces herself to her feet despite being weakened, dodges danger, and races to take control of the tanker to prevent imminent disaster.
Wrenches open the door and leaps aboard the tanker, quickly assesses the situation, and maneuvers the vehicle to escape threat.
Attempts to fend off a powerful Undead Sven despite weakened state, showing bravery but struggles physically.
Races the tanker past the convoy to protect the school bus full of children, refusing to bail out despite danger.
Returns from the explosion, severely burnt but alive, showing dedication and resilience.
Realizes the danger of the fire chasing the tanker and floors the gas pedal to try to outrun it, managing to keep control despite the advancing flames.
Does not bail out of the tanker even though flames are close, showing restraint and awareness of the danger to others in the convoy, especially the children in the school bus.
Survives a massive explosion, walking out scorched but alive, demonstrating physical resilience and mental toughness.
Expresses joy at reuniting with Carlos, laughs despite exhaustion.
Grasps Betty's wrist tightly and commands her not to touch her, then immediately relaxes grip realizing Betty's pain.
Maintains sharp, focused eyes and precise movements despite severe physical exhaustion and heavy sedation.
Shows emotional awkwardness and discomfort with physical contact after prolonged isolation.
Laughs and makes a dramatic entrance despite the dangerous environment.
Keels over immediately after her initial effort, overwhelmed by physical and mental exhaustion.
Cuts Betty short when she expresses concern for Alice's wounds and ignores advice to rest.
Acknowledges Valentine and responds with a somewhat teasing but friendly 'Disappointed?'.
States she came back because of Valentine, indicating loyalty and care.
Tosses Valentine a corny fridge magnet as a small friendly gesture.
Shows dismissiveness toward Betty's warnings and needs (e.g., not resting and changing clothes without gratitude or regard).
Broke into an Umbrella facility, hacked into their computers, and downloaded satellite trajectories while staying off the grid.
Realizes her watch is gone after a fire but quickly assesses the situation by looking at the sky, demonstrating situational awareness.
Immediately reacts to danger by grabbing saddlebags and running for cover beneath a porch.
Responds confidently and with a touch of humor when K-Mart comments on her being presumed dead.
Engages in a calm, controlled conversation with K-Mart, establishing rapport and gathering information.
Pauses to acknowledge the kids’ awe and the stories they tell, indicating awareness of her influence and reputation.
Despite herself, Alice is warming to K-Mart.
Admits to letting someone die when asked what happened to her.
Supports Valentine's suggestion to go to Vegas despite tension, aligning with the group's best interest.
Comments on K-Mart's innocent sleeping face without mockery or judgment.
Shares a small moment of light conversation with K-Mart about Las Vegas, showing some openness.
Does not respond negatively or dismissively when Carlos questions whether they are the freaks, showing tolerance and thoughtfulness.
Pins a cutting of Arcadia, a hopeful symbol, showing determination and refusal to surrender.
Acknowledges her own emotional evasiveness and discomfort but skillfully deflects with humor.
Admits to not understanding or controlling her evolving powers, showing self-awareness but also uncertainty.
Slams on the brakes abruptly in response to a sudden halt, demonstrating quick reaction and situational awareness.
Notices the presence of many crows and a human skeleton, quickly deduces that the crows have been feeding on tainted flesh.
Immediately orders others to roll up windows to prevent the scent from attracting the crows.
Decides to turn the truck around and go back into danger to assist the besieged school bus.
Recognizes the territorial nature of the crows and instructs to keep moving to avoid them.
Reacting quickly to the danger by spinning the flatbed truck back toward the danger zone to assist the besieged bus.
Acknowledges the urgency and the threat without freezing or becoming indecisive.
Cites knowledge from Discovery Channel as source for crow behavior, which may be seen as less rigorous or tactical knowledge.
Observes and comments insightfully on the desolation of the city, connecting the absence of undead to the birds picking it clean.
Does not take the lead or show direct action in this excerpt; mostly observant and thoughtful.
Shares watch duty with Carlos, alert and responsive to unusual sounds, showing vigilance and concern for group safety.
Immediately suspicious of new route suggested by Valentine, indicating distrust but also care for group's well-being.
Immediately suspicious of the suggested detour around the impassable road, showing alertness and intuition.
Catches faint noise and recognizes the sound of rotor blades, demonstrating acute senses and situational awareness.
Immediately suspicious and cautious about the situation, actively takes initiative to move the blockading freight container to help the group proceed.
Warns Betty and Valentine to get down before the cable snaps, saving their lives.
Responds coolly to Valentine's thanks, downplaying her heroic action.
Warns others to get down before the cable snaps, preventing injury or death.
Quickly tells others to stop the winches after the cable snaps.
Kneels to closely inspect the damaged cable and listens carefully for noises inside the container.
Commands others to get back to protect them from danger.
Engages directly in combat to defend herself and others from the Undead.
Uses aikido move to quickly neutralize threat, protecting her companions.
Effectively fights off multiple undead using two kukris, decapitating several enemies and surviving intense close combat.
Maintains control and awareness despite being surrounded by many undead, showing skill and confidence under pressure.
Moves to help the rest of the beleaguered convoy.
Freezes when seeing Umbrella logo flash in her eyes, Kukris hanging loosely from her hands (shows moment of hesitation/distraction during crisis).
Slays the last of the Undead in her immediate vicinity, removing immediate threats.
Moves to help the rest of the beleaguered convoy after clearing initial threats.
Suddenly freezes with kukris hanging loosely in hands after a flash of the Umbrella logo appears in her eyes, indicating distraction and hesitation.
Still frozen, unable to help her friends during the attack, visibly distressed and fighting Umbrella's control over her.
Remains frozen and unable to help her friends during an urgent and dangerous moment, visibly struggling with internal control.
Fights superhumanly against Umbrella's control to retain her autonomy.
Attacks aggressively and lethally the Umbrella personnel without hesitation.
Moves quickly and decisively through a derelict building towards hostile targets, showing focus and determination.
Fights against Umbrella's control over her, enduring great physical agony but still winning, demonstrating strong willpower and resistance.
Successfully breaches the helicopter, killing multiple armed enemies quickly and efficiently, taking command of the situation confidently.
Grabs the Umbrella Tech's throat instantly to stop his attack.
Races after the escaping helicopter and tries to climb aboard to stop Isaacs, risking her own safety.
Responds briefly and pragmatically to K-Mart's concern by saying 'I'll live.'
Pushes the dead Umbrella Captain out of his seat and takes command of the situation.
Grabs the Umbrella Tech's throat instantly and aggressively after the pilot is killed, demonstrating quick reaction and control.
Races for the helicopter as it takes off and jumps to grab the runners beneath the helicopter, showing physical agility and determination.
Loses her grip and falls after being shot through the hand while trying to board the helicopter, indicating a misjudgment or vulnerability in the moment.
Despite injury and falling, she climbs back on board and orders others to their positions, maintaining leadership and composure.
Wants to analyze the plane's instrumentation to determine its last bearing, demonstrating investigative thinking and awareness of strategic information.
Reassures Valentine about her wound despite its severity, showing leadership and emotional support under pressure.
Senses something wrong and acts decisively by urging the group to move on, indicating alertness and decisiveness.
Pauses alone at Carlos' grave, showing a moment of emotional vulnerability but does not let it hinder her leadership afterward.
After mourning, returns to lead the group with renewed resolve, wearing dog tags as a symbol and responding to K-Mart's concern with command.
Comforts Valentine during her coughing fit, reassuring her about the anti-virus.
Uses binoculars to scout the enemy position carefully, confirming the location of the secret entrance surrounded by thousands of undead, showing vigilance and strategic observation.
Comforts Valentine during a severe coughing fit and encourages her by informing there is an anti-virus available, demonstrating calmness, empathy, and leadership under pressure.
Stops Valentine to hand her a packet of smokes, showing care despite the grim situation.
Knows Jill is beyond help but can't bear to lose another friend, indicating emotional connection and compassion.
Acknowledges Jill's condition realistically, knowing she is beyond help but struggles emotionally to accept it.
Comforts and supports others despite difficult circumstances, offering small but meaningful gestures like handing over herbal cigarettes to Jill.
Accepts leadership responsibilities as indicated by Valentine naming her as a key person in the next phase of their plan.
Shows hesitation and emotional difficulty in facing loss, which could interfere with decisive action.
Stays behind to hand over the Red Journal and face the approaching Undead alone, ensuring others' safety.
Responds calmly and without hostility when L.J. surprises her, lowering her gun and asking 'What are you doing here?'.
Hands the Red Journal to K-Mart and chooses to stay outside the helicopter facing the approaching Undead alone.
Watches the helicopter take off and recedes into the distance calmly despite the threat of a thousand Undead approaching.
Spins around with gun in hand when sensing movement but quickly assesses the situation and lowers the gun.
Shares a look with L.J. and draws her gun cautiously while entering the eerie complex.
Nudges L.J. to alert him to a potential threat, scaring him but helping keep him alert.
Carefully enters an unguarded, eerie underground complex with L.J., remaining alert and drawing her gun when they see possible signs of danger.
Observes and processes ominous environmental clues (blood trails, smashed fittings, bullet holes, signs of a fight) indicating danger without panicking.
Nudges L.J. to alert him about potential danger in the ventilation shafts, demonstrating situational awareness and quick thinking.
Shrugs when asked how she knows about the White Queen's background, showing a casual, somewhat dismissive attitude
Refers to the White Queen's sister as 'a homicidal bitch', a blunt and harsh statement
Acknowledges the moral trade-off implied by the White Queen's sister (kill a few, save a lot) with a tone of skepticism
Identifies the White Queen A.I. correctly and explains its nature and background quickly, showing familiarity with complex technical concepts.
Shrugs and dismisses how she knows certain information almost casually, showing some confidence and control in tense situations.
Tells Paco, the little dog, to stay for safety despite his unhappiness.
Smiles at L.J. when he asks for good luck, offering reassurance.
Leads L.J. into a dangerous, dark laboratory corridor without hesitation.
Orders Paco the dog to stay behind for safety, showing awareness of the risks and clear leadership.
Nods and proceeds confidently into the pitch-black dangerous area despite unknown threats.
Smiles reassuringly at L.J. who hopes to come along, demonstrating calm control over the situation and team morale.
Notices threat quickly and takes initiative to investigate, instructs others to stay and guide her
Focuses on mission rather than joining L.J.'s reaction to his threat level
Recognizes the twisted intelligence behind the arrangement of dead bodies and quickly identifies movement on the CCTV, showing keen observation and situational awareness.
Takes initiative by equipping an earpiece and moving off alone into the darkness, directing others to guide her, indicating confident and skillful behavior.
Moves alertly through the labyrinth of cryo-stasis tanks, attempting to track movement and threats around her.
Turns quickly with weapon ready after sensing movement behind her, showing readiness to respond to danger.
Questions L.J. about directions amid confusing environment, indicating uncertainty and reliance on others for guidance.
Fights against Isaacs/Tyrant who strikes with inhuman speed and strength, but gun is knocked away indicating momentary loss of weapon control.
Catches the naked clone of herself abruptly freed from cryo-stasis, holds and eases her to the ground to help her breathe.
Cradles the dead Clone of herself, showing a moment of recognition and sorrow before easing the body to the ground.
Eyes filled with murderous rage after the Clone dies.
Cradles the clone's dead body, showing emotional restraint afterward and slowly eases it to the ground.
Enters a corridor and systematically searches for Isaacs/Tyrant despite a tense atmosphere.
Recognizes the replica environment from her past experiences, indicating good situational awareness.
Hunts for the Isaacs/Tyrant proactively within the mansion.
Dodges a sudden lunge from Isaacs/Tyrant and retaliates effectively with a Kukri, slicing deep into the opponent's chest.
Unleashes an immense psychic blast to stop the attack and defend herself and others.
Focuses inward and endures great physical suffering silently, showing resilience but no direct interaction with others in this scene.
Uses psychic powers skillfully to stop tentacle attack and unleashes a powerful psychic blast that severely damages the Tyrant.
Persists despite severe physical exhaustion and injury, getting back to her feet and attempting to continue the fight.
Is overwhelmed and flung through a door with great force, ending up badly injured and bleeding, with a broken mind and body.
Deliberately leads the Isaacs/Tyrant into a laser trap to defeat him, protecting others despite her own weakened state.
Despite being severely wounded and barely able to stand, she forces herself up and fights back against the Isaacs/Tyrant.
Draws the Isaacs/Tyrant into a deadly laser trap by deliberately leading him into the glass corridor, demonstrating foresight and strategic planning.
Uses the environment and technology (laser grid trap) skillfully to defeat a seemingly invincible opponent.
Initially appears helpless and physically defeated, sliding to a halt at the end of the corridor.
Watches calmly as the Isaacs/Tyrant is killed by a precise laser, showing confidence in the plan and its execution.
Reflects on having come full circle with the Isaacs/Tyrant defeat, indicating situational awareness and strategic understanding.
Makes a dry, confident remark 'Yeah... you're the future alright' about the Isaacs/Tyrant's demise, demonstrating self-assurance and recognition of the outcome.
Interrupts a cold, emotionless meeting to declare she is coming for Umbrella, taking Doctor Isaacs' place at the table.
Is shown with hundreds of her clones awakening, implying she will bring many friends to confront the enemy.
